titleStmt.title: Louis Brown v. J.C. Mitchell and James Bogant. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus

bibl.title: Louis Brown v. J.C. Mitchell and James Bogant. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: FILE No. 6352
In the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory before Hon. Chief Justice Boyle
Territory of Washington }ss County of King
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus in the matter of Louis Brown
The petition by his attorney John E. Costello represents and says that he is illegaly restrained of his liberty.

That he is unlawfully imprisoned, detained confined and restrained of his liberty by one James Bogant the city jailer of the city of Seattle, at the city jail of the city of Seattle in the County of King in the Territory of Washington and by Chief of Police J.C. Mitchell of said City of Seattle

That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal and that the illegality there of consists in this to wit 1st That the said petitioner Louis Brown on the 1st day of November 1888 was tried and committed in the the Court of Justice's Soderberg in the Seattle Precinct for the crime of Vagrancy that said Justice sentenced the said Brown to pay a fine of $50.00 and to further serve an imprisonment for the term of 15 days the same to be of hard labor in the streets of Seattle.
That upon the detention of said Jugdement

the counsel for the defendant then and there gave a verbal notice of appeal and intention to appear to the District Court of said County that thereafter on the 17th day of November 1888 the said Justice ordered and the said Mitchell Bogant executed his imprisonment in the City jail and to further work on the said streets of Seattle
That the said records of said Justices Court does not contain any record of such confinement to the County Jail or of any record of commitment if such was ordered and executed.
That said said records are false, irregular or and incomplete.
That said and commitment is false irregular incomplete and illegal.
That the ordinance and act of City of Seattle under which said Brown was so tried and convicted is unconstitutional illegal and void.
That the said penalty imposed by the said Justice was illegal, unconstitutional and void.
That said commitment was illegal, unconstitutional and void.
That the said Justice Soderberg did not have Jurisdiction of the subject matter of said action

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to the said Mitchell and Bogant commanding them to have the body of Louis Brown before your honor at a time and place therein to be specified to do and receive what shall then adn there be commanded by your Honor concerning him together with the time and cause of said Browns detention and said writ and that he may be restored to his liberty
Dated on the 22nd day of November 1888
Louis Brown by his attorney John E Costello

Then personally appeared the afore named John E. Costello attorney for Louis Brown and makes oath that the above statement and contents of said petition subscribed to by him is true and he believes them to be true. Subscribed and sworn to before me this 22nd day of Nov. A.D. 1888 H.T. Jones Justice of the Peace in and for Seattle Precinct King County W.T.
In the matter of Louis Brown Habeas Corpus
Petition
FILED NOV 22 1888 W.E. Ledgerwood
John E. Costello Washington ss. Seattle W.T.
